summary: The Babysitter - TheWritingBisexual - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Babysitter - TheWritingBisexual - Multifandom [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Fic Rec: The Babysitter by TheWritingBisexual

Summary:  Peter is totally fine. One hundred percent. Superheroes don’t get sick. Besides, a fever is just an overrated hot flush, right?

Characters: Peter Parker, Natasha Romanoff

Tags: Fluff, SickFic

Words: 1,268

Notes:  My friend @angstyparker has written a really great drabble that I wanted to share with you guys. It’s a SickFic focusing on the friendship between Peter Parker and Natasha Romanoff (and who doesn’t love momma spider fics?). The characterization is fantastic, and so is the balance between description and dialogue. If you love reading Peter fics, Natasha fics, or if you just want to read a well-written drabble, then look no further. 10/10 would recommend. x

blog.name: newtsfantasticwitch
blog.title: Living In Dreams
blog.description: FANGIRL |Taurus| ❤️|Holland| ❤️ "What could be wrong with a life if it's spent with the person you love?" |Gryffindor|Whovian|Sherlockian|Katycat| MASTERLIST

body:
*Tour Guide* (Peter Parker X Fem!Reader)

Ok, so with this thing I’m adventuring into the vast world of Peter Parker fics. It’s the first one. And honestly, it’s not that good, haha. Don’t hate me, please. It’s late and I’m in a transition period in my life so the idea came and I tried to write it down. Still, I hope you enjoy it! 💜💜💜

Imagine being new at school and Principal Morita asking Peter to show you school.

~~~

“Oh, so you must be our new student!” Principal Morita exclaimed cheerfully. You’d met him before when you and your parents went to ask for information about the school. Of course, he didn’t seem to remember very well that you were there that day “Well, here’s your schedule… But still you might need a tour around school…” he thought about that matter for a few seconds, looking at the students passing, before his eyes reflected he’d found a solution “Parker!” he called. Two boys that were just passing by stopped at the man’s mention; one of them walked towards you two, his eyes widened in surprise and reflecting a bit of worry. One of his brown curls fell softly on his forehead, giving him an adorable look.

“I want you to meet your new classmate, (Y/N) (Y/L)” said Principal Morita motioning at you with his left hand. You gave the Parker boy a kind smile that tried to tell him he had nothing to worry about. Your message must have been caught by some of his neurons, because his expression relaxed slightly and he returned you the gesture “And I wanted to ask you to be her… "Tour guide” around school"

“Oh” so he didn’t have to worry (at least not about getting expelled or something like that) indeed “Y-yeah, sure”

“Perfect!” Morita turned to look at you “You’ll be in good hands.”

“T-thank you” you responded, but by then the Principal had already left to his office, to do his job and mind his own business. You couldn’t blame him: He was such a busy man; running a school is not an easy task.

“Well, uh, welcome to Midtown, (Y/N)” said the boy. You could notice he was still a bit nervous, but it was nothing compared to how nervous you were: Being new at school is tough. However, Principal Morita had improved the experience by providing you with a “guide” “I-I’m Peter, by the way”

“Oh, well, it’s very nice to meet you, Peter” you replied, your fingers fiddling with the hem of your sleeve. You had to admit that you weren’t the best at making friends and the last thing you wanted was to do something stupid and screw everything up in front of Peter.

Peter walked to the other side of the hallway, were the boy who was accompanying him was standing; he’d been waiting for him all along.

“And this is Ned-” started Peter.

“-Leeds” Ned interrupted, grinning.

“Y-yeah. He’s my best friend.”

“And his guy on the chair…” murmured Ned. You cocked an eyebrow not knowing what he meant, yet amused by his comment.

“Shush!” Peter murmured back apprehensively “Erm… T-this is (Y/N) (Y/L) and I-I… Principal Morita asked me to show her school”

“Cool!” exclaimed Ned joyfully “Let’s begin our tour, then. So the Principal’s office is here, but of course you know that already…” Ned kept talking while leading your way along the corridor, then your turned to the left and got to another corridor. You saw a small stretch of stairs on the right and Peter stepped ahead and lead you through it.

“This is the locker corridor” he said when you were just about to reach the top. It was a large, crowded corridor much bigger than the others, of course, so all the students had enough space to handle the lockers. “It’s like the corridor. Everyone gathers he–”

“Wait a minute, I was the one leading the tour here!” pouted Ned crossing his arms. You could do nothing but chuckle at his complaint.

“But Principal Morita asked me!” he replied, crossing his arms as well. He seemed a little bit more confident now that he was with Ned, but still he was nervous to somehow make the fool of himself in front of you.

“Fine…” Ned gave in “Proceed”

“Thank you. Well, you prob–” Peter suddenly interrupted himself. He tilted his head and fixed his eyes on the center of your clavicle “Wait, d-do you like Harry Potter? I mean, your necklace…”

How observant!

You were indeed wearing a Harry Potter necklace that day. As a matter of fact, when you chose it that morning, you hoped somebody at your new school would notice it.

“Oh, I-I do” you looked down at your necklace, your cheeks colouring with a slight shade of pink “D-do you–?”

“You’re in company of two professional geeks, how wouldn’t we?” answered Ned before you’d even finished the question and smiled. Peter smiled too, shyly, his cheeks turning ruby red.

You smiled widely. This had definitely been a very good welcome. You never imagine you could be so fortunate to meet people as crazy as you, especially on your first day. Maybe changing school wasn’t as bad as you thought after all.

“Then…” you said jovially “I have the feeling that we’ll get a long very well…”

~~~

Your tour around school continued as enjoyable as it had been so far and ended successfully. You had now the knowledge of where the gymnasium, the lab, the cafeteria and the restrooms were, just to mention some of the locations they had so greatly showed you.

Nevertheless, you had to go to class now. The three of you.

“What’s your first class, (Y/N)?” asked Ned. He was such an awesome person. He was really funny and outgoing and made everything enjoyable with his occurrences and his cheerfulness. You felt so fortunate to have met him. To have met both of them.

And you really liked how Peter was. I mean, you’d just met him, but he’d already won a place in your heart. He was very kind and funny and interesting and sweet. And for some reason, you found him extremely adorable.

(Y/N), please tell me you’re not developing a crush on him. Don’t.

Also, he was… Cute.

No! Stop. You just met him. This is not good, stop.

“Physics” you answered.

“Oh” the happiness of the environment seemed to have lowered by your answer “We have Chemistry.”

“Oh”

“But” added Peter “the rest of your day is equal to ours. So we’ll see you in an hour. I mean… If you do want to… Be with us.”

“Are you kidding? You just met a professional geek,” you said, imitating Ned’s earlier words “how couldn’t I?”

You three smiled.

“So, see you in an hour” you headed to what they’ve showed you as the Chemistry lab, leaving them standing there, looking at you impressed.

“She is incredible” commented Ned, still gazing at you “She’s like us, but she’s a girl…”

“Yeah” replied Peter. He was absolutely dazzled by you “She is.”

~~~

I really, really, really hope you enjoy it! 💜💜💜

“I want you to meet your new classmate, (Y/N) (Y/L)” said Principal Morita motioning at you with his left hand. You gave the Parker boy a kind smile that tried to tell him he had nothing to worry about. Your message must have been caught by some of his neurons, because his expression relaxed slightly and he returned you the gesture “And I wanted to ask you to be her… "Tour guide” around school"

“Oh” so he didn’t have to worry (at least not about getting expelled or something like that) indeed “Y-yeah, sure”

“Perfect!” Morita turned to look at you “You’ll be in good hands.”

“T-thank you” you responded, but by then the Principal had already left to his office, to do his job and mind his own business. You couldn’t blame him: He was such a busy man; running a school is not an easy task.

“Well, uh, welcome to Midtown, (Y/N)” said the boy. You could notice he was still a bit nervous, but it was nothing compared to how nervous you were: Being new at school is tough. However, Principal Morita had improved the experience by providing you with a “guide” “I-I’m Peter, by the way”

“Oh, well, it’s very nice to meet you, Peter” you replied, your fingers fiddling with the hem of your sleeve. You had to admit that you weren’t the best at making friends and the last thing you wanted was to do something stupid and screw everything up in front of Peter.

Peter walked to the other side of the hallway, were the boy who was accompanying him was standing; he’d been waiting for him all along.

“And this is Ned-” started Peter.

“-Leeds” Ned interrupted, grinning.

“Y-yeah. He’s my best friend.”

“And his guy on the chair…” murmured Ned. You cocked an eyebrow not knowing what he meant, yet amused by his comment.

“Shush!” Peter murmured back apprehensively “Erm… T-this is (Y/N) (Y/L) and I-I… Principal Morita asked me to show her school”

“Cool!” exclaimed Ned joyfully “Let’s begin our tour, then. So the Principal’s office is here, but of course you know that already…” Ned kept talking while leading your way along the corridor, then your turned to the left and got to another corridor. You saw a small stretch of stairs on the right and Peter stepped ahead and lead you through it.

“This is the locker corridor” he said when you were just about to reach the top. It was a large, crowded corridor much bigger than the others, of course, so all the students had enough space to handle the lockers. “It’s like the corridor. Everyone gathers he–”

“Wait a minute, I was the one leading the tour here!” pouted Ned crossing his arms. You could do nothing but chuckle at his complaint.

“But Principal Morita asked me!” he replied, crossing his arms as well. He seemed a little bit more confident now that he was with Ned, but still he was nervous to somehow make the fool of himself in front of you.

“Fine…” Ned gave in “Proceed”

“Thank you. Well, you prob–” Peter suddenly interrupted himself. He tilted his head and fixed his eyes on the center of your clavicle “Wait, d-do you like Harry Potter? I mean, your necklace…”

How observant!

You were indeed wearing a Harry Potter necklace that day. As a matter of fact, when you chose it that morning, you hoped somebody at your new school would notice it.

“Oh, I-I do” you looked down at your necklace, your cheeks colouring with a slight shade of pink “D-do you–?”

“You’re in company of two professional geeks, how wouldn’t we?” answered Ned before you’d even finished the question and smiled. Peter smiled too, shyly, his cheeks turning ruby red.

You smiled widely. This had definitely been a very good welcome. You never imagine you could be so fortunate to meet people as crazy as you, especially on your first day. Maybe changing school wasn’t as bad as you thought after all.

“Then…” you said jovially “I have the feeling that we’ll get a long very well…”

~~~

Your tour around school continued as enjoyable as it had been so far and ended successfully. You had now the knowledge of where the gymnasium, the lab, the cafeteria and the restrooms were, just to mention some of the locations they had so greatly showed you.

Nevertheless, you had to go to class now. The three of you.

“What’s your first class, (Y/N)?” asked Ned. He was such an awesome person. He was really funny and outgoing and made everything enjoyable with his occurrences and his cheerfulness. You felt so fortunate to have met him. To have met both of them.

And you really liked how Peter was. I mean, you’d just met him, but he’d already won a place in your heart. He was very kind and funny and interesting and sweet. And for some reason, you found him extremely adorable.

(Y/N), please tell me you’re not developing a crush on him. Don’t.

Also, he was… Cute.

No! Stop. You just met him. This is not good, stop.

“Physics” you answered.

“Oh” the happiness of the environment seemed to have lowered by your answer “We have Chemistry.”

“Oh”

“But” added Peter “the rest of your day is equal to ours. So we’ll see you in an hour. I mean… If you do want to… Be with us.”

“Are you kidding? You just met a professional geek,” you said, imitating Ned’s earlier words “how couldn’t I?”

You three smiled.

“So, see you in an hour” you headed to what they’ve showed you as the Chemistry lab, leaving them standing there, looking at you impressed.

“She is incredible” commented Ned, still gazing at you “She’s like us, but she’s a girl…”

“Yeah” replied Peter. He was absolutely dazzled by you “She is.”

~~~

I really, really, really hope you enjoy it! 💜💜💜

body:
Venom’s blood lust vs chocolate

Venom: We must feed! We should eat their arms and their legs and their faces and-!

Eddie: No Venom, we are not going to eat people!

Venom: I hunger for flesh!

Eddie: No Venom! How about you eat a chocolate bar instead?

Venom: Why?

Eddie: because you are threatening to eat people now come on, try it. *waves chocolate bar*

Venom: *eats it*

Eddie: Better?

Venom: Better.



So I heard Venom’s canniblism can be control with chocolate which is hilarious.
